UserAccount.title: UserAccount
UserAccount.description: Stores user account information. Does NOT include authentication credentials.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user account.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

Transaction.title: Transaction
Transaction.description: Represents a financial transaction (expense or income).

tagIds.description: References to Tags. (Relationship: Tag N:N Transaction)

Category.title: Category
Category.description: Represents a category for classifying transactions.

parentId.description: Reference to parent Category. Represents sub-category relationship.  If null, this is a top-level category. (Relationship: Category 1:N Category)

type.description: Type of the category (e.g., expense, income).

RecurringTransaction.title: RecurringTransaction
RecurringTransaction.description: Represents a recurring transaction (e.g., rent, salary).

id.description: Unique identifier for the recurring transaction.

startDate.description: Date when the recurring transaction starts.

endDate.description: Date when the recurring transaction ends. If null, it continues indefinitely.

frequency.description: Frequency of the transaction (e.g., monthly, weekly).

id.description: Unique identifier for the credit card.

name.description: Name of the credit card (e.g., Visa, Mastercard).

closingDate.description: Day of the month when the credit card closes.

dueDate.description: Day of the month when the credit card is due.

Installment.title: Installment
Installment.description: Represents an installment payment for a purchase.

isPaid.description: Indicates whether the installment has been paid.

Budget.title: Budget
Budget.description: Represents a monthly budget for a specific category.

month.description: The month for which the budget is defined (e.g., 2024-01).

amount.description: Budgeted amount for the category in the specified month.

FinancialGoal.title: FinancialGoal
FinancialGoal.description: Represents a financial goal (e.g., saving for a car).

id.description: Unique identifier for the financial goal.

name.description: Name of the financial goal (e.g., 'New Car').

currentSavings.description: Current amount saved towards the goal.

targetDate.description: Target completion date for the goal.

Tag.title: Tag
Tag.description: Represents a tag for grouping transactions.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, DBAC, and support secure list operations (QAPs). User-owned data is structured under `/users/{userId}`. Authorization independence is achieved by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. For instance, data like `transactions`, `categories`, and `budgets` are nested under the user's document, ensuring that access control can be based solely on the `request.auth.uid` and the path. Collaborative data is not present in this app.

QAPs are supported through structural segregation. Each collection under `/users/{userId}` contains data with a homogeneous security posture, allowing straightforward security rules that don't filter data based on document content. Path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}/transactions/{transactionId}`) simplifies list operations, as rules can easily grant access to all documents under a user's path. The `UserAccount` document itself contains essential user data, and subcollections under each user hold their respective transactions, categories, budgets, credit cards, financial goals and tags.
